tool.name: JoinCalculateFields

param.name: Feature Class
param.dialogReference: Select the target feature class or table for which values will be updated in the attribute table.

param.name: Unique ID Needed to Assure Correct Values Are Computed
param.displayname: Target Feature Class or Table Unique ID Field
param.expression: Unique ID Needed to Assure Correct Values Are Computed
param.dialogReference: A unique ID that is the same between both tables in which the field calculation will be performed.

param.name: Update Field
param.dialogReference: Select the field in the feature class or table that will be updated with data from a different table or feature class.

param.name: Update SQL Query
param.displayname: Optional SQL Query to Perform Before Field Calculation on Target Data
param.dialogReference: An optional SQL query that will allow you to make selections so only certain records will have field calculations performed on them. E.g., "Elevation >4000", will result in a selection of records that have elevation greater than 4000 and only these records will have a field calculation performed on them.

param.name: Value Table or Feature Class
param.dialogReference: A feature class or table that contains the values used to update the previously entered feature class or table.

param.name: Join Field
param.dialogReference: A unique ID that is the same between both tables in which the field calculation will be performed.

param.name: Value Field
param.displayname: Select the Field With the Update Value
param.dialogReference: Select the field in the feature class or table that contains the values used to update the first input feature class or table.

param.name: Value SQL Query
param.displayname: Optional SQL Query to Perform Before Field Calculation on Value Data

tool.summary:
This tool is designed to update attributes in one table from those in a different table. This is similar to a field calculation performed when tables are joined. However, there is no need to join tables to use this tool and doing so may reduce performance.

For further information about the NRGG Field Calculator toolbox please contact the Northern Region Geospatial Group, GIS Program Manager, 406-329-3511.
